subject: Home & DIY
title: Bluetooth LE: The Unsung Smart Home Hero
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Bluetooth LE: The Unsung Smart Home Hero.

hook.text: Bluetooth Low Energy runs on a coin cell for up to five years. It's in smart locks, trackers, and fitness bands.

buildup.text: BLE sends tiny data bursts then sleeps. A temperature sensor may wake for 3 milliseconds every 10 seconds.

discovery.text: BLE 5.0 quadrupled range to 200+ meters and doubled speed. Bluetooth Mesh lets BLE devices relay messages like Zigbee.

twist.text: BLE's weakness: phones are the main hub. Leave home and your BLE devices often can't communicate until you return.

climax.text: Apple's Find My network uses BLE from a billion iPhones to locate AirTags anywhereâ€”crowdsourced BLE at planetary scale.

punchline.text: Five years on a coin battery changed everything.

quiz.question: How does Bluetooth Low Energy achieve multi-year battery life?
options: It transmits tiny bursts and sleeps between them
It uses a lower voltage than standard Bluetooth
It only activates when a phone is nearby
